Hybrid AMM + CLMM

What happens under the hood when you swap or provide liquidity

The Swap Architecture of Xebra currently supports traditional Uniswap V2 pools with uniform liquidity and will soon integrate Uniswap V3-style concentrated liquidity pools.

Key Components

Automated Market Maker (AMM): Xebra utilizes the AMM model, allowing users to trade assets directly from liquidity pools. This model replaces the traditional order book system.

Liquidity Providers (LPs): Users who provide liquidity to the pools are known as LPs. They deposit their assets into the pool and, in return, receive LP tokens as a receipt of their deposit. These tokens can be redeemed for the underlying assets plus any accrued fees.

Trading Mechanics

Price Determination: The relative value of assets changes continuously during a swap, causing the final execution price to fall between the starting and ending price. This dynamic ensures that the pool always has liquidity for trades.

Price Impact and Slippage: Xebraâ€™s interface provides real-time price impact estimates, including warnings for unusually high impacts. Users can set slippage tolerance levels to protect against unfavorable price changes during transaction processing.

Fees and Rewards: Trading fees are distributed to liquidity providers, incentivizing them to keep their assets in the pool and maintain liquidity. Given testnet, trading fees and rewards are currently zero.

Impermanent Loss: LPs should be aware of the potential for impermanent loss, which is the difference between holding tokens in an AMM versus holding them in a wallet. This risk arises from the price volatility of the pooled assets.

Add Liquidity Tutorial

Xebra supports traditional Uniswap V2 pools with uniform liquidity and will soon add Uniswap V3-style concentrated liquidity pools. Providing liquidity allows you to earn fees and rewards, facilitating trades and maintaining liquidity within the Movement ecosystem (on mainnet).

Provide Liquidity on Xebra Tutorial

Provide liquidity to Xebra Liquidity Pools

Visit the Xebra Liquidity Page Liquidity Pools to view the list of all available pools. You can check the current pool TVL in dollar terms and the current APY (both of those values are randomly generated for testnet).

Click the â€œAdd Liquidityâ€ button next to your chosen pool to open the Add Liquidity panel.

Enter the amount of each token you wish to add. Ensure you have sufficient balances in your wallet.

Click 'Add Liquidity' and sign the transaction in your wallet. 

Once the transaction is confirmed, your funds will be added to the pool.

Tracking and withdrawing liquidity from Xebra Liquidity Pools

Head over to the Xebra Portfolio page to view your current positions and the current dollar value of your holdings

Hover over to the - sign next to 'Add Liquidity' and click on 'Remove Supply'.

Sign the transaction and your withdrawal will be processed.

Thatâ€™s all folks, it is actually that easy ðŸ™Œ 

Start providing liquidity on Xebra and earn rewards while supporting the ecosystemâ€™s stability!

For best outcomes, provide and withdraw liquidity across multiple pools and days to build a strong on-chain Movement profile.

Xebra Swap

Introduction to swapping on Xebra AMM

Introduction

Xebra Swap is a peer-to-peer system designed for exchanging cryptocurrencies on the Movement M2 chain. It leverages the automated market maker (AMM) model to facilitate seamless and efficient token swaps without the need for traditional order books.

How It Works

Swapping Process: Users can sell their existing tokens for a proportional amount of the desired tokens. During this process, a small swap fee is deducted and distributed as incentives to liquidity providers.

Trading Fees: Whenever someone trades on Xebra Swap, a fixed fee is charged. For testnet/ devnet, fee obviously is zero.

Earning Fees: Liquidity providers earn a share of the trading fees generated from the swaps in the liquidity pool.

Price Impact: The final execution price of a swap is affected by the liquidity at different price points. Higher liquidity leads to lower price impact, while lower liquidity results in higher price impact.

Slippage: Users can set a slippage tolerance, which limits the acceptable price impact during a transaction. If the final execution price falls within this range, the transaction executes; otherwise, it fails.

Advantages

Decentralized: No need for a central authority or order book, enabling peer-to-peer transactions.

Efficient: AMM model ensures continuous liquidity and low slippage trades.

Yield: Liquidity providers earn rewards from trading fees, incentivizing participation.

Risks

Impermanent Loss: Providing liquidity exposes users to the risk of impermanent loss, where the value of tokens in the AMM may differ from simply holding them in a wallet.

Explore Xebra Swap and experience seamless, decentralized trading within the Movement ecosystem.

Swap Tutorial

Swapping tokens on Xebra is a simple and efficient way to trade different cryptocurrencies within the Movement ecosystem. 

Swap on Xebra Tutorial

Follow this step-by-step guide to execute a token swap on Xebra:

Visit the Xebra Swap page

Input Token and Amount Details:

Select the token to sell (first token) and the token to buy (second token) from their respective dropdown menus.

Enter the amount of the first token you want to sell. The amount of the second token you will receive is auto-calculated.

Review and execute the Swap: 

Click on "Swap Now" to complete the trade. The new tokens should appear in your wallet shortly.

For best outcomes, swap across multiple tokens and days to build a strong on-chain Movement profile.

Faucet Tutorial

A crypto faucet is an application that dispenses small amounts of cryptocurrency to users for users to transact, more often on testnet networks. 

To get gas for transactions on the Movement Sui Testnet, visit the Movement Faucet, input your Sui wallet address, and mint â€˜MOVEâ€™ testnet tokens. 

Now, follow these steps to claim your testnet tokens from the Xebra Faucet:

Visit the Xebra Faucet Page: Xebra Faucet

Click on â€œConnect Walletâ€ and choose your preferred wallet (e.g., Sui, Nightly, Razor).

Click on the â€œAirdrop Coinsâ€ button. 

Approve the transaction in your wallet popup to claim test tokens: USDC, USDT, WETH, GMOVE, wBTC, XBT.

Voila! The faucet will process your request. Check your wallet for the newly added testnet tokens and start exploring Xebra and Movement.

For best outcomes, claim faucet tokens across multiple days to build a strong on-chain Movement profile.

How to even start?

Welcome to Xebra Trade on Movement Testnet!

Getting Started

First things first, letâ€™s get you set up and ready to roll in the Xebra-Movement ecosystem.

Join our family: 

Join the Xebra and Movement Discord Servers

Follow Xebra and Movement on Twitter

Follow Xebra and Movement Galxe Spaces

Setup your wallet:

Install and connect your preferred wallet (e.g., Sui, Nightly, Razor).

Change network/Add Custom RPC:

For Sui Wallet: Go to Wallet Settings -> Network -> Custom RPC -> https://devnet.baku.movementlabs.xyz/

For Nightly Wallet: Change the network to â€˜Movement Suiâ€™

For Razor Wallet: Change the network to â€˜Movement Sui Devnetâ€™

Mint Testnet Tokens

Head to the Movement Faucet, input your Sui wallet address, and mint â€˜MOVEâ€™ testnet tokens.

Visit the Xebra Faucet, connect your wallet and mint Xebra testnet tokens.

Voila, let's effing move! Youâ€™re ready to rock both offchain and onchain tasks on the Xebra-Movement Testnet.

Quests Introduction

With the Movement Labs Testnet officially live, weâ€™re super excited to announce Xebraâ€™s Community Program ðŸ¥³ðŸŽ‰. Weâ€™ve established five unique guildsâ€”Pathfinders, Explorers, Creators, Scholars, and Spartansâ€”each with distinct roles and tasks.

Guild summaries:

Pathfinders ðŸ§­  welcome new members, answer questions, and join in Discord events.

Explorers ðŸ—» engage other communities and are active on socials.

Creators ðŸŽ¨ make art, memes, stickers, and videos.

Scholars ðŸŽ“ write articles & threads about protocol and ecosystem tech and teach members.

Spartans âš”ï¸ complete on-chain tasks and activities thereby testing and promoting Xebra tech.

Users can join multiple guilds with no restrictions. 

Conclusively, Pathfinders, Explorers, Creators, and Scholars cover off-chain quests, while Spartans handle on-chain quests. Join a guild today by completing any of their tasks.

What is Xebra?
Why Movement?
Parthenon Testnet Guide
Xebra Swap
Xebra Perps
Socials
For Developers
Wen $XBT?
Powered by GitBook
Why Movement?

#1 reason for us building on Movement is that our tech team is already, heavily, â€˜move-pilledâ€™. We were one of the first few teams to deploy on Aptos/Sui and understood the power of a multi-threaded VM combined with an object ownership based architectureâš¡ï¸


The main benefits of move lang in our context:
> Performance: parallel execution, low latency (important for quick margining)
> Security: re-entrancy is prevented by default, enables faster upgrades
> No global spikes in gas costs during high volatility (important for orderbook liveness)


Weâ€™re also super excited about the whole movement ecosystem, not just M1 ðŸ—’ï¸
> We believe in the modular chain thesis
> The prospect of launching our customisable app-chain in the future via movement SDK can unlock many interesting liquidity bootstraping use cases


New Move L1s have seen growing developer interest but have failed at migrating whale EVM liquidity due to:
> Lack of foundational DeFi products being already present
> Inferior bridging UX, new wallets etc. for users to download

Movementâ€™s seamless cross-vm communication and backward compatibility with base networks also enables superior liquidity sharing
